Description: Lower body sherd of East Greek, probably North Ionian pottery bowl; interior glazed black with added red band lined in white; exterior: two friezes separated by band with added red band lined in white: above, part of large floral motif with red; group of dots and undetermined motif as filling ornament; below, frieze of goats grazing to right (from left, head, antler, neck with red, shoulder and foreleg of first goat; hind leg of second); pendant roundel, hooked maeander and blobs as filling ornament; below, glazed area
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no. 46)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.259)
